questions.text: A circuit element that opposes a change in current is a(n):
In a parallel RLC circuit, the current is at a minimum at the resonant frequency because:

choices.text: The voltage is at a minimum.
The total impedance is at a maximum.
The inductive and capacitive reactances are zero.
The resistance is at a maximum.

questions.text: The average value of a full-wave rectified sine wave with a peak value Vp is:
A Zener diode is primarily used as a:
An operational amplifier (op-amp) has a very high:

choices.text: Input impedance and low output impedance
Input impedance and high output impedance
Low input impedance and low output impedance
Low input impedance and high output impedance

questions.text: The efficiency of a Class A transformer-coupled amplifier is approximately:
The octal number system is a base-___ system.
A decoder is a combinational circuit that converts:

choices.text: Binary information from n input lines to a maximum of 2^n unique output lines.
Binary information from 2^n input lines to n output lines.
Multiple input lines into a single output line.
A single input line into multiple output lines.

questions.text: A JK flip-flop is in a 'toggle' condition when:
The component of the CPU that decodes an instruction is the:
Direct Memory Access (DMA) is a feature that allows:

choices.text: The CPU to directly access I/O devices.
Certain hardware subsystems to access main system memory independently of the CPU.
All memory to be accessed at the same speed.
The operating system to manage memory.

questions.text: What is the difference between a struct and a union in C?

choices.text: struct can have members of different data types, while union cannot.
struct allocates memory for each member, while union allocates a shared memory space for all members.
union is a keyword, while struct is not.

questions.text: In C++, what does :: (Scope Resolution Operator) do?

choices.text: It is used for pointer dereferencing.
It is used to define a member function outside a class or to access a global variable when there is a local variable with the same name.
It performs a bitwise OR operation.
It is used to create a reference.

questions.text: What is the primary role of the new and delete operators in C++?

choices.text: To perform dynamic memory allocation and deallocation.

questions.text: A microprogrammed control unit is generally:

choices.text: Faster than a hardwired control unit.
More flexible and easier to modify than a hardwired control unit.
Less complex than a hardwired control unit.

questions.text: The Harvard architecture has:

choices.text: A single shared memory for instructions and data.
Separate memories for instructions and data.
A single bus for both addresses and data.

questions.text: Which of the following is an example of a real-time operating system (RTOS)?
The Transport Layer (Layer 4) of the OSI model is responsible for:

choices.text: Providing reliable or unreliable end-to-end data delivery.
Framing data for transmission on the physical medium.

questions.text: A network device that connects different networks and forwards packets between them is a:
A 'Denial of Service' (DoS) attack is an attempt to:

choices.text: Make a machine or network resource unavailable to its intended users.
Install malicious software on a system.

questions.text: Which of the following languages is NOT context-free?

choices.text: The set of all palindromes over {a,b}.

questions.text: The 'pumping lemma' is a tool used to prove that a language is:
The CMYK color model, used in printing, is a(n):
The process of representing a continuous image with a finite set of digital values is called:
A graph in which there is a path from every vertex to every other vertex is called a:
Which of the following sorting algorithms has a best-case time complexity of O(n)?

choices.text: Bubble Sort (with an optimization for sorted lists)

questions.text: A 'trigger' in a database is a:

choices.text: Stored procedure that is automatically executed in response to certain events on a particular table.
A view that combines multiple tables.
A security mechanism to grant permissions.

questions.text: The 'shell' in an operating system is the:

choices.text: Core component that manages system resources.
User interface that allows users to interact with the kernel.

questions.text: 'Extreme Programming' (XP) is:

choices.text: An agile software development framework that aims to produce higher quality software and higher quality of life for the development team.
A model focused on comprehensive upfront planning and documentation.

questions.text: 'White-box testing' is a testing technique where:

choices.text: The tester has no knowledge of the internal workings of the software.
The tester has knowledge of the internal logic and structure of the code.
The software is tested for its usability.
The software is tested by the end-users.

questions.text: In UML, a 'State Diagram' is used to model:

choices.text: The static structure of a system.
The interaction between objects over time.
The dynamic behavior of a single object, showing how it responds to events.
The physical deployment of the system.

questions.text: The principle of 'Abstraction' in OOP means:

choices.text: Hiding the internal implementation details and showing only the essential features of an object.
Creating a new class from an existing class.
The ability of a message to be displayed in more than one form.
Binding data and the functions that operate on them into a single unit.

questions.text: A 'Simple Reflex Agent' in AI is an agent that:

choices.text: Has an internal model of the world.
Acts only on the basis of the current percept, ignoring the rest of the percept history.
Considers the utility of its actions.

questions.text: 'Semantic Nets' are a knowledge representation technique that uses:

choices.text: A graph of nodes (representing concepts) and links (representing relationships).

questions.text: The 'perceptron' is the simplest form of a(n):
In engineering drawings, a 'sectional view' is used to show:

choices.text: The interior details of an object as if it were cut open.

questions.text: The Internal Rate of Return (IRR) is a metric in capital budgeting that:

choices.text: Measures the profitability of potential investments.
Is the discount rate that makes the Net Present Value (NPV) of all cash flows equal to zero.
Is always equal to the MARR.
Calculates the time it takes to recover the initial investment.

questions.text: The Critical Path Method (CPM) is a project management technique for:

choices.text: Identifying the sequence of tasks that determines the shortest possible project duration.

questions.text: Plagiarism in an engineering context is:

choices.text: Using the ideas or work of another person without giving proper credit.
Collaborating with other engineers on a project.
An effective way to complete reports quickly.

questions.text: The primary difference between the Nepal Engineering Council (NEC) and the Nepal Engineers' Association (NEA) is that:

choices.text: NEC is a regulatory body (licensing), while NEA is a professional society (for members).
NEA is a government body, while NEC is a private organization.
NEC sets project budgets, while NEA executes them.

questions.text: In a three-phase system, the phases are typically separated by:
A bilateral circuit is one whose properties are:

choices.text: The same in either direction of current flow.
Different for different directions of current flow.

questions.text: A race condition in a sequential logic circuit occurs when:

choices.text: The clock signal is too fast.
The output depends on the unpredictable sequence or timing of other events.
The circuit enters an unused state.
The setup and hold times are violated.

questions.text: What is a page in the context of virtual memory?

choices.text: A fixed-size block of virtual memory.
The entire address space of a process.

questions.text: What is the function of the telnet protocol?

choices.text: To provide a bidirectional interactive text-oriented communication facility using a virtual terminal connection.

questions.text: A regular expression is a sequence of characters that defines a:
Dijkstra's algorithm is used to find the:

choices.text: Minimum spanning tree of a graph.
Shortest path from a single source vertex to all other vertices in a weighted graph.
All-pairs shortest path in a graph.
Topological sort of a directed acyclic graph.

questions.text: In an operating system, a semaphore is used for:
In software engineering, what is 'coupling'?

choices.text: The degree to which the elements inside a module belong together.
The degree of interdependence between software modules.
The number of lines of code in a module.
The time it takes to compile a module.

questions.text: What is an 'expert system' in AI?

choices.text: A system that mimics the decision-making ability of a human expert in a narrow domain.
A general-purpose AI that can perform any intellectual task a human can.

questions.text: The time value of money is a concept that states:

choices.text: Money available now is worth more than the same amount in the future due to its potential earning capacity.
The value of money is constant over time.
Money available in the future is worth more than money available now.
The value of money depends on the current inflation rate only.

questions.text: A T-flip flop is created by connecting the inputs of which flip-flop together?
What is the primary function of the finally block in exception handling (e.g., in Java or C#)?

choices.text: To execute code regardless of whether an exception was thrown or caught.
To specify the type of exception to handle.

questions.text: The 'Internet of Things' (IoT) refers to:

choices.text: The global network of interconnected computers.
A network of physical objects embedded with sensors, software, and other technologies to connect and exchange data over the internet.
The social media platforms on the web.
A new version of the World Wide Web.

questions.text: The rendering pipeline in computer graphics describes the:

choices.text: Sequence of steps used to transform a 3D scene into a 2D image.

questions.text: The 'Big O' notation in algorithm analysis is used to describe the:

choices.text: Asymptotic upper bound or worst-case time complexity of an algorithm.
Exact execution time of an algorithm.

questions.text: The V-Model in software development is an extension of the:
A 'model-based agent' in AI differs from a simple reflex agent because it:

choices.text: Maintains an internal state or model of the world.
Acts only based on the current percept.

questions.text: A 'tender' in project management is a:

choices.text: Formal offer to supply goods or services at a stated price.

questions.text: Which of the following is a key characteristic of SRAM (Static RAM)?

choices.text: It is cheaper and denser than DRAM.
It is faster than DRAM and does not need to be refreshed.

questions.text: A voltage of 10V is applied across a parallel combination of a 5 Ω resistor and a 20 Ω resistor. What is the total current drawn from the source?
Simplify the Boolean function F(A, B, C) = Σ(0, 1, 2, 4, 5, 6) using a K-map.
A computer system has a 16 KB cache, a 2 MB main memory, and a block size of 128 bytes. How many cache lines are there in the cache? (1 KB = 1024 bytes)
A network has a class B address 150.100.0.0. You want to create 100 subnets. What is the minimum number of bits you need to borrow from the host part, and what is the corresponding subnet mask?
A triangle with vertices A(2,2), B(5,2), and C(3,5) is rotated by 180 degrees about the origin. What are the new coordinates of vertex C?
Consider a hash table of size 7 with the hash function h(k) = k mod 7. Show the state of the table after inserting keys 10, 18, 25, 3, 17 using chaining to resolve collisions.

What is the All-Pairs Shortest Path in the given graph using an appropriate algorithm (e.g., Floyd-Warshall)? (A simplified question: What is the shortest path from A to C?) 
Graph: A-B (cost 2), B-C (cost 3), A-D (cost 1), D-C (cost 5)

A system with a single resource has three processes: P1 (requires 5 units), P2 (requires 3 units), and P3 (requires 8 units). The system has a total of 12 units of the resource. If P1 holds 2, P2 holds 2, and P3 holds 3, is the system in a safe state?

choices.text: Yes, it is in a safe state.
No, it is in an unsafe state.

questions.text:
What is the result of the following SQL query on a table Products? 
SELECT Category, AVG(Price) FROM Products GROUP BY Category HAVING COUNT(*) > 10;

choices.text: The average price of all products.
The categories and their average prices, for all categories.
The categories and their average prices, but only for categories that have more than 10 products.
The names of products in categories with more than 10 items.

questions.text: A software project is estimated to be 400 KLOC (Kilo Lines of Code). Using the basic COCOMO model (Effort = a × (KLOC)^b), if a=2.4 and b=1.05, what is the estimated effort in person-months?
How many flip-flops are required to build a MOD-12 counter?
In TCP, if the current congestion window size is 16 KB and a timeout occurs, what will be the new congestion window size if the Slow Start Threshold (ssthresh) is set to 8 KB?
Which string is accepted by a grammar with the rules: S → aSb | ε ?
In a neural network, a single neuron receives two inputs (x1=0.5, x2=0.8) with corresponding weights (w1=0.3, w2=0.6). If the bias is -0.2, what is the net input to the activation function?
Consider a hard disk with 10 concentric tracks. If the disk rotates at 6000 RPM, what is the average rotational latency?
Which software design principle suggests that classes should be open for extension but closed for modification?
What is the result of applying a 2D shearing transformation in the x-direction with a shear factor of 2 to a point (3, 4)? (The new coordinates are x' = x + shx * y, y' = y)
What is the decimal equivalent of the hexadecimal number (2AF.C)_{16}?
A project requires an initial investment of Rs. 1,000,000. It is expected to yield Rs. 300,000 per year for 5 years. What is the simple payback period?
